alert.note: Alert for St Croix; St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands (Virgin Islands) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 06 at 4:14PM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flash flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...All of Puerto Rico and the United States Virgin Islands. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Low-water crossings may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - A drier air mass moved today across Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands. A strong trough remains north of the islands and it is expected to pull additional pulses of showers and thunderstorms across the region. Since the soils are so saturated and the rivers are running high, any additional moderate to strong activity could trigger flooding, mudslides and rapid river rises.
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be prepared to take action should Flash Flood Warnings be issued.

area.areaDesc: St Croix; St.Thomas...St. John.. and Adjacent Islands
